intro: Tashiroea, commonly known as the Japanese dandelion, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features yellow flowers that resemble those of the common dandelion, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Tashiroea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional herbal practices.
